3.20.18  3:14 am   if you just say C7, the 7 is diminished, right?

     yes, although watch out for calling it 'diminished' because diminished usually is about b5. and 'minor' is usually about b3. when saying the 7 is lowered it's probably best to say 'flat 7' (b7)

      so its more like Cb7...

     C(b7) yes. watch out, Cb7 actually looks like it means Cb(7), like B7. for example Bb7 means Bb(7) not B(b7)

      In the minor scale however, Cm7 is automatically diminished

     watch out for that, 'diminished' is associated with the 5. when you say Cm7 is diminished it sounds like you mean it has b5 but it does not

      because the scale goes like this so there it makes sense and you don't need the b.

     right. minor or major refers to the 3, but Cmaj7 has a maj7 by association and Cmin7 has a min7 (flat 7) by association. The only weird part is when you say C7 it means major third, but flat 7. that's just what it means. (it's shorthand for C dominant 7, and the word dominant doesn't make any sense there but that's just what it's called) it's just a weird quirk of spelling, like spelling quirks in english or other languages

      i might be overthinking this.

3.19.18  10:52 pm   What does it mean to pan audio?

     put it to the side. if you pan it all the way to the left that means it only plays on the left speaker. if you pan it all the way to the right it means it only plays in the right speaker. if you put it in the center it means it plays equally out of both speakers. if you pan it just a little bit to the left, it plays a little bit softer on the right than on the left, so it sounds like it is coming from a little bit to the left. if you slide the pan knob left and right, it will sound like the sound is moving left and right. i hope that makes sense

3.19.18  10:39 pm   what do you think made the first machine? to manufacture things, we use machines, which were manufactured by other machines, correct? and if a person did it, what did they do it with? A machine? Help.

     a simpler machine, which was made by a simpler machine, which was made by something almost too simple to be called a machine but you might call it that if you want to. which was made by something defintely too simple to be called a machine but was definitely an interesting tool. which was made by a simplier tool, which was made by something that might be too simple to call a tool but you could call it a tool if you want, which was made with a rock

3.19.18  6:39 pm  how do regular major/minor chords such as Cm FM Gm Dm differ from C7m F7M G7m etc?

     the 7 is supposed to go after the m, otherwise it actually looks like it means something different, because of some quirks about the way 7's are used when writing chord symbols. but the 7 means there's another note you have to have. Cm7 includes Bb note, and so on. Cmaj7 includes B note, and so on. 'C7maj' is unfortunately not clear as to what it means and this is due to a quirk about what just C7 means (hint, it might not be which 7 you'd expect)

     
so far I've made it the basics on notes and stuff but I really never grasped on chords since i have very tight schedules and unfortunately had to rest the music department in my life to do other work. actually, three questions, how do you know which notes are #/b when attempting to read music with various time signatures rather than glancing at the keyboard to know what note is which on the scale?

     you can do it by feel

      I'd really appreciate your response

3.19.18  6:26 pm   3.18.18  7:08 pm What does an art theif do with a stolen painting?

     maybe just hide it or destroy it, which would increase the demand and value of copies

     How do you sell a famous painting that's been stolen, without it being obvious that you stole the painting?

     i don't know

      Even if you find an art collector who doesn't care that it's a stolen paining, the collector still can't really put up a famous stolen work of art on display in their home. When the mona lisa was famously missing, it would've looked awfully suspicious if some random person just happened to have it hanging up in their living room or something.

     i think he sold it to a museum and got busted a few days later

     because that's how i usually called it before going to college. also i find that 'superlocrian' just sounds a little pretentious to me.

3.19.18  3:17 pm   As much as I love jazz, I have never been able to "acquire" a taste for overly dissonant parts that somehow become recognied by music buffs as genius.

     depending on when and where you get out of your time machine, jazz might just mean pop. or it might mean background music that is easy to listen to, and not for geniuses. it might mean a car, or even a basketball team. jazz means so many things there is almost no way to tell what someone means when they say it. sounds like what you meant is nerd music

     So I wholeharedtly agree with your approach of focusing on the way music "sounds", but you seem to have an excellent grasp of theory,

     you can try to make a music theory, but the music is only going to find a new way to evade the theory. happens every time, it's the darndest thing

      and this is why so many of your fans ask for tips on studying, yet you are often dismissive of such questions.

     i am not. i tell them very clearly what i think the best strategy is. i've said it hundreds of times here, over and over, and i will continue to say it until you start getting it

      I just wanted to let you know that you're a hero among aspiring musicians, and we just want to know if you have any tips on how to learn all the rules, even if it means we have to break them every now and then.

     i feel like i've spent hundreds of hours explaining this over and over again, and it feels like people never seem to quite get it. we're talking about something malleable, like hot soft clay. it can be molded into absolutely any position. maybe the reason i can never quite get people to understand this this is because it is firm enough that it will stay where it was molded, briefly, for a hot 5 seconds, but as soon as you so much as turn away or go into another room, the whole thing can and will change on you. which is by the way the biggest part of the fun

3.19.18  3:11 pm   in m7b5, does the b affect the 7 or the 5?

     the 5. which is ironic because the m actually affects the 3 more than it affects the 7
